title: Keyser Trad apologises for saying husbands can beat wives | Daily Mail Online
text: 'A clumsy attempt to explain the Koran': Muslim leader Keyser Trad apologises for saying a husband can beat his wife as 'last resort' - and condemns all violence against women Muslim leader Keysar Trad says angry husband can beat his wife as 'last resort' He was asked about controversial Koranic verse by Sky News host Andrew Bolt 'It is permissible for him to beat her light with his hands,' it says, Bolt claims Mr Trad said chocolates and flowers should be first option known as 'counselling' He said this should be considered 'before you even consider using your hand' But Bolt shakes his head during the response and indicated his disagreement Published: 09:56 GMT, 23 February 2017 | Updated: 10:53 GMT, 23 February 2017 524 shares
